page.title: 04WINTON HOUSE
page.content: On a steep bank above the Tyne, stands Winton House,focal point of the Winton estate.The drive is shaded with many different sorts of trees.The major part of the estate is woodland and in the open parts,crops are grown regularly.As the drive curves around, the house comes into view. The exterior is very grand and imposing.The house was built about { {1480.}Inside,the ceilings are very ornate.The house is now divided into five flats.The tower has a lovely view,where you can see most of Pencaitland.The main rooms have paintings of ancestors of the Ogilvy family,who own the house now.Throughout the house there are French clocks which are (very ornate) decorated with black and gold.
